metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5615 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
cgiemail and cgiecho allow remote attackers to inject HTTP headers via a newline character in the redirect location.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgiemail - 1.6-37+deb7u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cgiemail package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6-37+deb7u1build0.16.04.1').
